intro: Connarus ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Connarus ecuadorensis plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
